title: ICE with HRTB and lifetime on subtrait

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
I'm using a lifetime parameter on a trait such that I can constrain `Item` to `for <'a> &'a X`. I tried to "encapsulate" the lifetime into a subtrait to avoid [other issues](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/30472) and got an ICE on stable, nightly and with/without NLL. I suspect this usage should error but I could be mistaken.

```rust
trait Sink {
    type Item;
    fn next(&mut self, Self::Item);
}
trait SinkA<'a>: Sink {}

struct X(u8);

fn abc<I>(mut i: I) where for<'a> I: SinkA<'a, Item=&'a X> {
    let x = X(0);
    i.next(&x);
}

```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=3bd47be323a4c437c35707e0078c0526&version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2015))

